events.title: Book Signing: Greg Nudelman
events.description: Greg Nudelman appears at the SX Bookstore to sign copies of his latest work.
events.access: Interactive Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge

events.title: Central Health Breakfast Taco Challenge
events.description: Central Health, Austin and Travis County’s public health care entity, is redeveloping the Brackenridge Campus—14.2 acres of prime downtown Austin real estate across from the new Dell Seton Medical Center at The University of Texas. Austin is re-imagining what this innovative new development could look like and we’d love your caffeine- and taco-fueled creative brain power to help us see the future. From a public market to health- and wellness-related spaces and places, there’s no limit to what this power block could become in the heart of Austin’s new Innovation Zone. Heck – it could feature a healthy breakfast-taco stand. Come dream with us.
events.access: Interactive Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge

events.title: Confirmation Bias: Innovation’s Blind Eye
events.description: Great product teams understand the importance of dissenting feedback. However, a team might drive toward an inferior product because it fixates on a few pieces of positive feedback, or a persuasive product lead might seek out data to support her pet feature. Moving quickly often requires trusting our intuition, but what is the difference between gut instinct and bias?
events.access: Interactive Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge

events.title: Voter Technology: A Reimagined Future
events.description: Aging voting technology means upcoming elections are more likely than ever to result in inaccurate ballots or in voters being unable to cast a ballot at all. This group of panelists is unafraid to both sound the alarm bells and inspire us all about what is at stake for the 2016 presidential election, what stands in the way of updated voter technology, and what the future of the voter experience could look like given the right tools.
events.access: Interactive Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge

events.title: Dirt, Drones and Data: The Future of Farming
events.description: Aging voting technology means upcoming elections are more likely than ever to result in inaccurate ballots or in voters being unable to cast a ballot at all. This group of panelists is unafraid to both sound the alarm bells and inspire us all about what is at stake for the 2016 presidential election, what stands in the way of updated voter technology, and what the future of the voter experience could look like given the right tools.
events.access: Interactive Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge

events.title: A Beginner's Guide to SXSW Film
events.description: A nexus of discovery and collaborative energy, SXSW Film kicks off in high gear with their annual Beginner's Guide. Answering questions like how do I get around Austin during the fest? When should I arrive to get into my movie? How do I navigate badge lines and how can I be sure to hit the best parties? Veteran SXSW participants and locals will share best ways to navigate Austin, the festival, ways to maximize social media during the event and even where to find the best eats. Rookies should come armed with questions and learn the tips and tricks to having the best experience while at the SXSW Film Festival and Conference.
events.access: Film Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge

events.title: Go Native or Go Home: Ads and Addictive Content
events.description: As brands crave a digital audience, and blogging evolves into a full-time gig, content partnerships are everything. Finding the creative sweet spot that inspires an audience while creating customers is the mark of native advertising that feels authentic, and effective.
events.access: Film Badge, Interactive Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge

events.title: Kick Off with Enterprise Ireland
events.description: Meet the Irish! Come and join Ireland’s most innovative tech companies for a drink at the Registrant Lounge on Friday at 5pm. Enterprise Ireland will be hosting a lively networking and drinks reception at the Registrant Lounge on Friday at 5pm to welcome everyone to SXSW 2016. We will be introducing our most innovative tech companies to SXSW 2016. Enterprise Ireland is the 3rd largest seed investor in the world , with over $700 million under management. So, please stop by, grab a drink and join the conversation and meet the delegation, IRELAND@SXSW 2016. We are interested in meeting you and showing everyone why the world is paying close attention to the innovation that has been pouring out of Ireland, so get on board and become part of our growing community.
events.access: Interactive Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge

events.title: SouthBites Coffee & Doughnut Break
events.description: Join us each morning for complimentary coffee and doughnuts courtesy of SouthBites!
events.access: Film Badge, Interactive Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge

events.title: Java Monster Mornings
events.description: Kick-off each day of SXSW with Java Monster Mornings! Swing by the Registrant's Lounge to grab your FREE Java Monster and breakfast while listening to live music. See ya there!
events.access: Film Badge, Interactive Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge

events.title: Building Smart Applications That Learn
events.description: Creating a smart web or mobile application is much easier when you have access to state-of-the-art image, language, and machine learning functionality. We will demonstrate how to build powerful applications that can understand natural language, either from textual or audio sources, make use of computer vision functions, such as face and object recognition, and easily access external data sources. Finally, we will show how to use machine learning to create a self-learning application. This workshop will be interactive, with participants creating their own application and deploying it on the cloud, mainly using the Wolfram Language.
events.access: Interactive Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge

events.title: Beat the Bully: Bring Light to Darkness on the Web
events.description: The internet creates bullies -- but it also creates heroes; the anonymous friends that race to send support when a mom posts on Facebook that her son got no RSVPs to his birthday party; those like Lizze Velasquez who's bullied backstory turned her into an online role model. Come to this panel to hear how online bullying, and online heroes, are being addressed from different perspectives: victims, bullies, creators, brands, platforms. Learn how the biggest voices – creators and brands – are using their platforms to speak up against online bullying. We promise to touch and to inspire, but mostly importantly, to provide a roadmap for bringing light to your corner of the web.
events.access: Interactive Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge

events.title: A Generational Challenge: Improving Nine Billion Lives
events.description: What will our Earth look like by the year 2020? 2030? Beyond? Join us at SXSW for a panel discussion that explores the long-term effects of today’s societal problems. Panelists will shed light on what is being done to address global challenges today and into the future and offer advice on what you can do to take action.
events.access: Interactive Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge

events.title: Solving Healthcare Challenges with Design Thinking
events.description: Often, new products seem interesting and inventive but struggle to gain traction due to misalignment with user needs and contexts. Design Thinking combines understanding of systems, human behavior and continuous learning to provide a process for creating new products and services that meet audience needs and fit conditions, constraints and behaviors that successful solutions must address. Participants in this session will learn the key principles and techniques in human-centric problem solving that allow teams to find and understand audience needs, generate solution ideas, test hypotheses, and iteratively refine and focus their solutions.
events.access: Interactive Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge

events.title: SXgood Hub Coffee Break presented by Sama Group
events.description: Did you know that over a billion people work full time and earn less than $3/day? At Sama, we believe that giving work is the most powerful solution to ending global poverty. We're on a mission to challenge traditional charity and prove that business is the key driver of social change.
events.access: Interactive Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge

events.title: Bitcoin and Blockchain Meet Up
events.description: The Bitcoin ecosystem has grown exponentially & now includes private blockchains, adoption by Wall Street, and a burgeoning array of new digital assets. Join us as Michael Terpin, co-founder of BitAngels and head of blockchain consulting firm, Transform Group/Coinovate, leads a truly interactive meet-up of leading Bitcoin enthusiasts, startups, investors & community VIPs for the third consecutive year to network and talk about all things Bitcoin.
events.access: Music Badge, Film Badge, Interactive Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge, Artist Wristband

events.title: Kicking Sass: How to Write CSS in a PostCSS World
events.description: For years, front-end developers have turned to preprocessors like Sass and CoffeeScript to fill in the gaps in native CSS and JavaScript. Although these tools have transformed and enhanced the way we write code, they've also forced us to work in nonstandard syntaxes, bouncing from one compiler to the next as we try to find the perfect build process. But what if there's a better way? Learn how postprocessors and transpilers can revolutionize your code and workflow. If the idea of writing proposed CSS4 and ES7 code today without compromising browser support sounds crazy, you're in for a surprise.
events.access: Interactive Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge

events.title: A Conversation with John Gaeta and Ana Serrano
events.description: From pioneering virtual cinema for the Matrix Trilogy to proofing the future shapes of Star Wars, John Gaeta has had a hand in the creation of some of the most iconic and soon to be most immersive moments ever created for mainstream audiences.
events.access: Music Badge, Film Badge, Interactive Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge, Artist Wristband

events.title: Content, Copyright, and Commerce
events.description: This has been quite a year for the music business and music copyright! Between the U.S. Copyright Office's report recommending changes to federal music copyright laws, ground-breaking decisions in BMI's rate court, DOJ reviews of regulatory frameworks, an ongoing debate about transparency and money flows in music licensing and emerging digital business models such as streaming, there is certainly no shortage of updates when it comes to current digital music business issues.
events.access: Music Badge, Platinum Badge, Artist Wristband

events.title: Hard Rock Hotels presents COLLiDE @ Container
events.description: COLLiDE is back at Container Bar for the 3rd year running, bringing you the best bands and DJS from around the globe. The three day event is brought to you by Hard Rock, OXFAM, JanSport, Slacker, Tilly’s, Dickies and The Guardian.
events.access: Music Badge, Platinum Badge, Artist Wristband

events.title: Slash
events.description: Neil is an introverted, questioning high school freshman. His main social outlet is the steamy erotic fan fiction he writes about Vanguard, the brawny, galaxy-hopping hero of a popular sci-fi franchise. When his stories are exposed in class Neil is mortified, but the fearless, effortlessly cool Julia comes to his defense. An erotic fan fic writer herself, Julia pushes Neil to publish his stories to an online “adult” forum, where they quickly grab the attention of the site moderator, Denis. When Neil is invited to present his work at a comic con live-read event, he has to face the fact that Denis’ interest in him may be more than simply professional… perhaps like his own feelings for Julia.
events.access: Film Badge, Gold Badge, Platinum Badge, Film Festival Wristband

events.title: Baby Shakes
events.description: Baby Shakes are a rock n’ roll-punk band from New York City. Mary on lead vocals and guitar, Judy on lead guitar and vocals, Claudia on bass and vocals, and Ryan on drums. With catchy melodic vocals over dirty guitars and a killer rhythm section, their influences range from The Ramones and Slade to Chuck Berry and 60’s Motown girl groups. Formed in 2005, they’ve released 4 singles, a 10” heart-shaped EP, a singles collection, and 2 full length albums. They have toured the US, Japan, Ireland, UK and Europe. Baby Shakes have shared the stage with The Romantics, The Boys, Shadows of Knight, The Undertones, Barracudas, Protex, Black Lips, Paul Collin’s Beat, among others. Currently, Baby Shakes just released their 2nd full length LP 'Starry Eyes' (Aug 2015) and are booking a Japanese Tour in February 2016 and a European Tour Fall of 2016. We're three girls and a guy and we all play and sing (and write our own music), so... Watch out boys and gals, the Baby Shakes are coming!!
events.access: Music Badge, Platinum Badge, Music Festival Wristband, Artist Wristband

presenters.name: Greg Nudelman
presenters.title: Principal
presenters.description: Greg Nudelman is a Mobile Experience Strategist and CEO of DesignCaffeine, Inc. For over 15 years he has helped his clients eBay, WebEx, Wells Fargo, PayPal, Safeway, Cisco, IBM, Associated Press and Groupon amass millions of satisfied customers.

presenters.name: Allison Abbott
presenters.title: Design Researcher and Strategist
presenters.description: As a Design Researcher with a focus on UX, Design Thinking, and Human-Centered Design, I'm passionate about creating products and services that solve real customer needs, and meet customers where they are...while still pushing the envelope on cutting-edge innovation and beautiful design.

presenters.name: Diego Bernal
presenters.title: Texas House Member Rep
presenters.description: Texas House Member Representative Diego Bernal is a social worker whose experience includes working with gang members in Detroit and at-risk youth in Harlingen, Texas as well as serving the NAACP Legal Defense Fund and the Mexican American Legal Defense and Educational Fund (MALDEF). After law school he became a MALDEF staff attorney, advocating and litigating on behalf of working people, children, and immigrant communities. He has championed issues including equitable public school funding, tolerance in schools and in the workplace, and electoral system integrity. As San Antonio City District 1 Councilman, he wrote and passed the strictest payday loan regulation in the state of Texas. Bernal also passed San Antonio's Non-Discrimination Ordinance. Representative Bernal was elected to the Texas House of Representatives in February 2015 and sits on the House Committee on Urban Affairs, and the House Committee on International Trade & Intergovernmental Affairs.

presenters.name: Henry Flores
presenters.title: Professor of Political Science
presenters.description: Henry Flores is a professor of political science who earned both his M.A. and Ph.D. from the University of California, Santa Barbara in Political Science. Flores is also an Army veteran of the Vietnam War serving two tours (1969–1971) with the 1st Cavalry Division where he served with the 1/7th Cavalry, commanded an artillery battery with the 1/30th Artillery, and was Deputy Chief of Staff of the Division. Since 1986, Flores has served as an expert witness in more than 50 federal voting and civil rights lawsuits. He is the author of The Evolution of the Liberal Democratic State With a Case Study of Latinos in San Antonio, Texas (2003) and coauthor of Mexican Americans and the Law (2004).

presenters.name: Bears Fonte
presenters.title: Exec Dir
presenters.description: Bears Fonté covers indie film and the film festival circuit for AMFM Magazine. He is the Founder and Executive Director of Other Worlds Austin, a new festival in Texas’ capital focused on SciFi. Prior to that, Bears served as Director of Programming for Austin Film Festival from 2012-14, overseeing some 200 films selected to screen at eight venues over eight days. The 2013 Festival saw 28 world premiere features and 7 films picked up at the festival or the week after. His most recent short film, THE SECRET KEEPER, has been selected by over 35 US Film Festivals since September of 2012. His feature thriller iCRIME, which he wrote and directed, was released on DVD, VOD and streaming by Vicious Circle Films in 2011. Bears also self-produced two web-series which have been seen by a combined ten million viewers. Prior to arriving in Austin, Bears wrote coverage for independent producers and coverage services in LA and placed in nearly every single screenwriting contest out there including Screenwriter’s Expo, Final Draft Big Break, Page International, Story Pros and Austin Film Festival. Bears received his BA from Carleton College in British Studies and Theatre Studies and a MFA in Directing from Indiana University and has directed over forty plays, including the Austin Critics Table nominee Corpus Christi, and the Austin Shakespeare Festival’s Complete Works of Shakspeare Abridged. He studied writing with noted playwrights Jeff Hatcher and Denis Reardon, and directed the first-ever professional productions by Princess Grace Award-winning and Pulitzer Prize-nominated playwright Don Zolidis and up-and-coming playwright Itamar Moses. He is currently working on a new five minute short to submit to festivals in 2015.

presenters.name: Martin Thomas
presenters.title: Film Critic/Co-Host
presenters.description: Martin Thomas is part of the old guard beginning his career as a film critic in 1996 on the Austin airwaves with the weekly TV show ‘The Reel Deal’. After a brief stint as a co-host on the WB’s weekly show ‘Behind the Screens’, Martin (along with the rest of the Reel Deal crew) took to the internet in 2004 where he continued as the cartoon character “Leon” for Spill.com. After Spill.com ended its run in 2013 Korey Coleman and Martin Thomas went on to form a new movie/entertainment entity, DoubleToasted.com, which won the Austin Chronicle's "Best of Austin" Award for Best Podcast of 2015.

presenters.name: Richard Whittaker
presenters.title: Staff Writer
presenters.description: A staff writer for the Austin Chronicle, Richard has regularly covered topics as diverse as film, politics, roller derby, He was an early adopter of the terrible habit of blogging and online film reviews in the mid-1990s, when he co-founded and became lead contributor to the Curmudgeon. His work appears in the Chronicle, and he is a regular contributor on OneOfUs.net's Highly Suspect Reviews and Digital Noise. He has previously written for Fortean Times, Inked, Gallery Watch, and the Ad Hoc family of magazines, and he was part of the editorial team at International Diplomacy and Peacekeeping News, and Disarmament Diplomacy.

presenters.name: Abigail Jacobs
presenters.title: VP, Brand Mktg and PR
presenters.description: Abigail is the Vice President of brand marketing, public relations and content + community for Brooklyn, NY based lifestyle brand west elm. In 2015 she was named one of the "Most Creative People in Business" by Fast Company magazine.

presenters.name: Camille Styles
presenters.title: Founder & Creative Dir
presenters.description: Camille Styles is the founder and creative director of lifestyle blog CamilleStyles.com, as well as a sought-after lifestyle expert and author of bestselling book, Camille Styles Entertaining. On her blog, she shares the creative entertaining ideas that inspire her parties and her life with hundreds of thousands of readers every month – her passion is to show readers approachable ways to turn everyday moments into celebrations. Camille is also a regular lifestyle contributor to numerous media outlets, and does styling work for national fashion and lifestyle brands. She lives in Austin, Texas, with her husband Adam and their kids Phoebe and Henry.

presenters.name: Shani Silver
presenters.title: Dir of Digital Content
presenters.description: Shani Silver is a writer and social media strategist who joined domino in June of 2015 as Director of Digital Content. She was previously the Chicago Editor of Refinery29, after which she joined Keep.com as Director of Content, Copy, & Social Media. Her freelance digital work appears on Refinery29, Nylon, and XOJane.

presenters.name: Christopher Wolfram
presenters.title: Programmer
presenters.description: Christopher Wolfram is a full-time student at an online high school. Over the last 3 years, Christopher has given talks at World Maker Faire NYC, the Wolfram Technology Conference, and was given a mentor/TA role at the Wolfram summer programs. In his spare time, Christopher writes code, travels, plays tennis, and explores 3D animation and modeling.

presenters.name: Lisa Bilgrei
presenters.title: Head of Sales Dev. SMP
presenters.description: Lisa Bilgrei is Head of Sales Development on the Sponsorship & Media Programs Team at Google. She oversees all sales activation functions focusing on insights driven premium media, branded custom content and brand experiences harnessing the culture and community of YouTube. She has 17+ years experience in advertising/sales and previously worked at advertising agencies Ogilvy & Mather, Y&R and Rapp Collins. She resides in Los Angeles with her husband and two kids.

presenters.name: Lizzie Velasquez
presenters.title: Motivational Speaker and Author
presenters.description: Born with a rare syndrome that prevents her from gaining weight, Elizabeth "Lizzie" Velasquez was first bullied as a child in school for looking different and, later online. When Lizzie Velasquez found the YouTube video—with over 4 million views—that called her the ‘World's Ugliest Woman,' she was devastated, saying she prayed she could scrub her syndrome off her face to have a life of less pain. But after her TED talk went viral, she found success—and loads of online support-- as a motivational speaker.

presenters.name: Michael Bellavia
presenters.title: CEO
presenters.description: Michael Bellavia is an Emmy winning executive producer and digital marketing executive and CEO of both HelpsGood, a social media agency, and Animax, an entertainment production company. HelpsGood uses social storytelling to help nonprofits, NGOs, government agencies and corporate social responsibility teams develop their content marketing and communication strategies. Clients include the Ad Council, United Way, Keep America Beautiful, Teach.org, Love Has No Labels, I Am A Witness, Perkins School for the Blind, Save the Children, Whole Foods and AT&T. Since 2010, Michael has led the social media efforts for Smokey Bear, the wildfire prevention icon, for which he was awarded the USDA Forest Service's highest honor - a Gold Smokey Bear Award. For more than a decade, Michael has also led Animax's multiplatform production efforts producing TV, games, apps, sites and other creative technology solutions for Disney, ESPN, Bravo, Fox, MTV and NBC. Michael is the former Chair of the New Media Council of the Producers Guild of America and has spoken at SXSW, NATPE, Digital Hollywood, CES, KidScreen and CTIA. Michael has an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BS in Engineering from The University of Michigan.

presenters.name: Rocco Pallatto
presenters.title: Dir/Dev
presenters.description: Rocco serves as the Director of Development for the Ad Council, managing Ad Council board partnerships and activations.

presenters.name: Andrew Revkin
presenters.title: Journalist
presenters.description: Andrew Revkin has covered science and the environment for 30 years in newspapers, magazines, books, documentaries and his New York Times blog, Dot Earth, winning the country's top science journalism awards multiple times. He was a staff reporter at The Times from 1995 to 2009.

presenters.name: Adam Falat
presenters.title: UX Practice Leader, Digital Health
presenters.description: Adam Falat joined Walgreens in 2011 and leads users experience design and strategy for digital health at the 115-year old company, which recently ranked number 35 on the Fortune 500 list.

presenters.name: Ashley Boyd
presenters.title: Business Dev Assoc
presenters.description: Ashley Boyd is on the business development team at Mad*Pow, where she is responsible for forging new relationships with clients across the healthcare ecosystem including payers, providers, pharma, government, health tech, patients and beyond. She is a passionate healthcare entrepreneur, business strategist and marketer with interest in new opportunities that incorporate creative design and novel approaches for problem solving.

presenters.name: Michael Jarjour
presenters.title: CEO
presenters.description: Michael Jarjour is president and CEO at ODH, Inc., a provider of data analytics solutions for the behavioral health field. Prior to leading ODH, Michael served as vice president, global commercialization and portfolio management at Otsuka Pharmaceutical and led the company’s global digital strategy. Before that, he led Kinematik, a company focused on developing scientific R&D solutions, as president and CEO. His strong entrepreneurial spirit stemmed from the first company he co-founded, Logonhealth Corporation, a provider of wireless handheld and web-based prescription solutions. Michael is committed to serving the tech and healthcare community. He is a venture partner and advisor at Mansa Capital, and previously served as CEO and board member of a healthcare technology company developed at the University of Pennsylvania.

presenters.name: Aaron Ladage
presenters.title: UI Engineer
presenters.description: Aaron Ladage is a UI engineer for DEG in Kansas City. He's the creator of inputtypes.com, a form input and onscreen keyboard testing utility, and has been a selected speaker at several prominent developer conferences, including SXSW Interactive, Future of Web Design NYC and HTML5DevConf San Francisco. Outside of work and freelance, Aaron is a cliché Kansas City BBQ snob and brews some really bad beer.

presenters.name: Ana Serrano
presenters.title: Chief Digital Officer
presenters.description: Ana Serrano is the Chief Digital Officer of the CFC and Founder of CFC Media Lab, the world-renowned institute for interactive storytelling created in 1997. Serrano is driving the digital transformation of the CFC into a unique blend of talent, product and company accelerator and creative production house. Most recently, she launched Canada's first digital entertainment accelerator IDEABOOST and serves as its Managing Director. To date, Serrano has directed the development of over 130 digital media projects, mentored over 50 start-ups, and has received numerous awards from the digital media, film, and theatre industries in both Canada and the U.S., including a Digital Media Trailblazing Award in 2015 from the Academy of Canadian Cinema & Television.

presenters.name: David Levin
presenters.title: VP Digital Licensing
presenters.description: David Levin joined Broadcast Music, Inc. (BMI) as Vice President VP, Digital Licensing in 2012. In his current role, he is responsible for the growth of digital revenue and developing strategies to address digital market needs.

presenters.name: Gary Greenstein
presenters.title: Partner
presenters.description: Gary Greenstein is a Partner in the Washington, D.C., office of Wilson Sonsini Goodrich & Rosati, where his practice focuses on intellectual property, technology licensing, and commercial transactions, with specialized expertise in the digital exploitation of intellectual property. He represents a wide range of technology companies in licensing transactions with copyright owners in the music, film and television industries, including large public companies and early-stage startups. He also regularly advises companies in litigation, audits, settlement negotiations, mergers & acquisitions, and initial public offerings.
